TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is an NORP national , who was born in DATE and lives in GPE , GPE . He was represented before the ORG by Mr O. Kazimov and Mr PERSON , lawyers practising in GPE .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the applicant , may be summarised as follows .
( a ) Criminal proceedings against the applicant .

DATE the applicant held a number of the highest managerial posts in the country 's oil sector , including the “ ORG and ORG . For DATE he worked as a First Deputy Prime Minister and , later , from DATE he was the Speaker of the Milli Mejlis ( the ORG ) . In DATE he resigned from his office , allegedly in protest of the ORG 's policies , and left the country . While abroad , he founded and led ORG ( the “ DPA ” ) with its headquarters in GPE . He currently resides in GPE .

As a result of the criminal investigation commenced in DATE , in DATE the Prosecutor General indicted the applicant for misappropriation of public funds , abuse of power and fraud during his work in the oil companies and in the government . ORG sought the applicant 's arrest and trial . On DATE ORG , based on ORG bill of indictment , issued an order for the applicant 's detention on remand pending trial . On DATE ORG upheld the district court 's order . However , the applicant was not actually arrested , because he had never returned to GPE since his departure in DATE .

Believing that if he returned home he would be immediately arrested , the applicant lodged , through his lawyer , a petition with ORG , asking for the substitution of the detention on remand by a house arrest pending trial . Under this condition , he would agree to return home and stand trial .

On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant 's petition . It held that the detention on remand was the proper pre - trial measure , because of the gravity of the alleged crimes , the applicant 's continued “ escape from the investigation , ” as well as the reasonable grounds to believe that the applicant would influence other parties to the proceedings in order to hinder the pre - trial investigation and the trial .

The applicant appealed against this decision to ORG . On DATE ORG refused to consider the appeal in substance . In accordance with its interpretation of the domestic criminal procedure law , the court held that no appeal could lie against a first instance court 's decision concerning a petition on replacement of a pre - trial detention by a house arrest .

At present , the applicant resides in GPE as a political refugee . The criminal proceedings against him are still pending and the order on his detention on remand is still in force . It follows that the applicant would be arrested and detained upon his return to GPE .
( b ) Rejection of the applicant 's candidacy for the presidential elections .

In DATE the ORG nominated the applicant as a candidate for the presidential elections of DATE . However , on DATE ORG ( the “ Commission ” ) rejected the applicant 's nomination based on LAW CARDINAL § CARDINAL of LAW .

The ORG filed a lawsuit in ORG , requesting the court to quash the ORG 's decision as unlawful . On DATE ORG rejected this request , holding that the ORG 's decision was lawful for CARDINAL reasons . Firstly , it found that the registration documents submitted to the Commission were not properly certified and legalised and , thus , were not in conformity with LAW requirements . Secondly , the applicant failed to submit evidence of the fact that he had no obligation before any foreign state ( in his case , GPE ) . Upon the ORG 's further appeal , on DATE ORG upheld ORG decision .
LAW of DATE
Section II . Fundamentals of the ORG .

According to LAW , the state power in GPE shall be based on the principle of separation of powers . The legislative , executive and judicial branches of the government shall be independent within the framework of their respective authority .
Section V. Legislative Power .
In accordance with LAW , the legislative power shall be exercised by the Milli Mejlis ( the ORG ) of GPE .
Article CARDINAL authorizes the Milli Mejlis to pass laws , constitutional laws and resolutions on the matters within its competence .

Pursuant to LAW , the Milli Mejlis has competence to establish rules , by way of passing laws , with regard to all the major spheres of state regulation including , inter alia , the human rights and freedoms , elections , judicial system , status of natural and legal persons , civil law issues , criminal responsibility , litigation procedure , enforcement of judgments , family law issues , labour and social security , finance and banking , taxation and customs , communications and transport , commercial transactions , defence and military service , ratification and denunciation of treaties , and the like .
Section VI . Executive Power .
In accordance with LAW , the executive power shall be exercised by the President of GPE .

Under LAW , the President is empowered , inter alia , to sign and publish laws passed by the Milli Mejlis as well as deal with matters not expressly referred to the authority of the Milli Mejlis by LAW .
Article CARDINAL provides the President with a right to veto the laws passed by the Milli Mejlis . The Milli Mejlis may overturn the presidential veto by a qualified majority of votes .
In accordance with LAW , the President shall issue decrees and orders with regard to matters within his competence .
Section X. Legislative System .

In accordance with LAW , the laws ( legislative acts ) of the Milli Mejlis shall have the superior legal authority over any other normative legal acts , except the LAW and acts adopted by public referendum . The presidential decrees and orders shall not contradict the laws passed by the Milli Mejlis .
